intro: Xanthorrhoea minor, commonly known as the small grass tree, is a unique plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage and a woody, bottle-shaped stem that stores water. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in spikes during the summer months. Xanthorrhoea minor is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. Its distinctive appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in Australian flora.
